attributes.action: Scrap anonymity on all social media platforms
attributes.additional_details: Cyberbullying or cyberharassment is a form of bullying or harassment using electronic means. Cyberbullying and cyberharassment are also known as online bullying. It has become increasingly common, especially among teenagers, as the digital sphere has expanded and technology has advanced. By scrapping anonymity on all social media platforms it means that not only will everyone will be responsible for what they post on social media but they will be easily identifiable.
attributes.background: I would like the government to scrap anonymity on all social media platforms in the UK to stop cyber bullying.

rejection.details:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331573

You may be interested to know that the Petitions Committee is investigating the issue of online abuse, as a direct result of the petitions it has received. You can find out more here: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/307/tackling-online-abuse/
